notes_display: Analysis by A.A. Gordus, University of Michigan 1974, by Neutron activation of streak; Obv.blind spot; legend as attested on coin: 11 h l. o. [m]zdysn [bgy] whl'n  ZY MRKAn [MRKA]| mazdēsn bay Wahrām  ī šāhān|; Rev: 3 h l. i.  'tw[ly] [ZY], 9 h l. o. wrh[r'n]| ādur ī wrhr'n|“the fire of Wahram”; | l'sty on altar shaft| rāst | “rasty”
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Wahram IV on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown cap; crown with mural element and two staggered wings; covered korymbos; two ribbons commencing to the left and right below the korymbos, pointing upwards; pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing below ball of hair; pointing upwards; earing consisting of two elements; tunica, neck-line edged with double row of pearls running from shoulder to the breast ornament (only upper part visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy wrhr'n ZY MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n W 'nyr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Wahrām ī šāhān šāh Ērān ud Anērān kē čihr az yazdān|"The Mazda-worshiping divine Wahram, King of Kings of the Iranians and non-Iranians, whose seeds/splendour is from the gods
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; on the shaft l'st (rāst, "just"); to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, three altar slabs; above bust with diadem and elaborate coiffure to the right, to the left and right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Wahram IV, holding a barsom with both hands, both figures facing inwards; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 3 h l. i. 'twly ZY, 9 h l. o. wrhr'n| ādur ī Wahrām|“the fire of Wahram”
